Title: Getting Started with QR-Based Restaurant Management System API

Nodes.Text: API for browsing menu items and placing orders in a QR-based restaurant system.

The generated code has dependencies over external libraries like UniRest and JsonMapper. JsonMapper requires docblock annotations like `@var`, `@maps`, and `@factory` to map JSON responses with our class definitions. Hence the docblocks in generated code cannot be disabled by deactivating the PHP configurations like `opcache.save_comments`. These dependencies are defined in the `composer.json` file that comes with the SDK. To resolve these dependencies, we use the Composer package manager which requires PHP greater than or equal to 7.2 installed in your system. Visit [https://getcomposer.org/download/](https://getcomposer.org/download/) to download the installer file for Composer and run it in your system. Open command prompt and type `composer --version`. This should display the current version of the Composer installed if the installation was successful.

* Using command line, navigate to the directory containing the generated files (including `composer.json`) for the SDK. 
* Run the command `composer install`. This should install all the required dependencies and create the `vendor` directory in your project directory.

Nodes.Title: Configuring CURL Certificate Path in php.ini

Nodes.Text: **Note** This is for Windows users only.

CURL used to include a list of accepted CAs, but no longer bundles ANY CA certs. So by default it will reject all SSL certificates as unverifiable. You will have to get your CA's cert and point curl at it. The steps are as follows:

1. Download the certificate bundle (.pem file) from [https://curl.haxx.se/docs/caextract.html](https://curl.haxx.se/docs/caextract.html) on to your system.
2. Add curl.cainfo = "PATH_TO/cacert.pem" to your php.ini file located in your php installation. “PATH_TO” must be an absolute path containing the .pem file.

[curl]; A default value for the CURLOPT_CAINFO option. This is required to be an
; absolute path.
curl.cainfo = PATH_TO/cacert.pem

Nodes.SuggestedLinkText: Configuring CURL Certificate Path in php.ini

Nodes.Text: The following section explains how to use the QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiLib library in a new project.
Open an IDE for PHP like PhpStorm. The basic workflow presented here is also applicable if you prefer using a different editor or IDE.
Click on `Open` in PhpStorm to browse to your generated SDK directory and then click `OK`.
Create a new directory by right clicking on the solution name as shown below:

Nodes.AlternateText: Add a new project in PHPStorm - Step 1

Nodes.Text: Name the directory as "test".

Nodes.AlternateText: Add a new project in PHPStorm - Step 2

Nodes.Text: Add a PHP file to this project.

Nodes.AlternateText: Add a new project in PHPStorm - Step 3

Nodes.Text: Name it "testSDK".

Nodes.AlternateText: Add a new project in PHPStorm - Step 4

Nodes.Text: Depending on your project setup, you might need to include composer's autoloader in your PHP code to enable auto loading of classes.
require_once "vendor/autoload.php";
It is important that the path inside require_once correctly points to the file `autoload.php` inside the vendor directory created during dependency installations.

Nodes.AlternateText: Add a new project in PHPStorm - Step 5

Nodes.Text: After this you can add code to initialize the client library and acquire the instance of a Api class. Sample code to initialize the client library and use the Api methods is given in the subsequent sections.
To run your project you must set the Interpreter for your project. Interpreter is the PHP engine installed on your computer.
Open `Settings` from `File` menu.
Select `PHP` from within `Languages & Frameworks`.
Browse for Interpreters near the `Interpreter` option and choose your interpreter.
Once the interpreter is selected, click `OK`.
To run your project, right click on your PHP file inside your Test project and click on `Run`.
The following parameters are configurable for the API Client:

Data:

*Default*: `30`

Whether to enable retries and backoff feature.
*Default*: `false`

The number of retries to make.
*Default*: `0`

The retry time interval between the endpoint calls.
*Default*: `1`

Exponential backoff factor to increase interval between retries.
*Default*: `2`

The maximum wait time in seconds for overall retrying requests.
*Default*: `0`

Whether to retry on request timeout.
*Default*: `true`

Endpoints for browsing menu items
The singleton instance of the `MenuApi` class can be accessed from the API Client.
$menuApi = $client->getMenuApi();

Nodes.Title: List Menu Items
Nodes.Name: listMenuItems
Nodes.Description: Returns the full list of menu items currently available for ordering.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `getResult()` method on this instance returns the response data which is of type [```MenuResponse```]($m/MenuResponse).

{
  "success": true,
  "count": 2,
  "data": [
    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0001",
      "name": "Margherita Pizza",
      "description": "Classic pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil",
      "price": 1199.0,
      "category": "Pizza",
      "image": "https://cdn.example.com/img/margherita.jpg",
      "isAvailable": true

    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0002",

      "description": "Spiced rice with marinated chicken",
      "price": 899.0,
      "category": "Main",
      "image": "https://cdn.example.com/img/biryani.jpg",

Nodes.Text: Endpoints for creating and viewing orders
The singleton instance of the `OrderApi` class can be accessed from the API Client.
$orderApi = $client->getOrderApi();

Nodes.Title: Place Order
Nodes.Name: placeOrder
Nodes.Description: Creates an order for the specified items and table.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `getResult()` method on this instance returns the response data which is of type [```OrderResponse```]($m/OrderResponse).

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: Order payload including items, table number, and customer details.

Nodes.Text: Represents the proxy server configurations for API calls. Create instance using `ProxyConfigurationBuilder::init('http://your.proxy.host')`
Methods

Data: Sets the proxy host address. Should be set during initialization via init() method.
Sets the port used to connect to the proxy server. **Default port:** 0
Enables or disables tunneling through the proxy server. **Default tunnel:** false
Sets both username and password in a single method. **Default user:** '', **Default pass:** ''
Sets the proxy authentication method. **Default authMethod:** CURLAUTH_BASIC

Nodes.Text: Client Initialization with Proxy Configuration
To configure the SDK to use a proxy server, initialize the proxy configuration during client setup as shown in the Usage Example.

CodeExamples.Title: Usage Example
CodeExamples.Text:
<?php

use QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiLib\QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiClientBuilder;
use QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiLib\Proxy\ProxyConfigurationBuilder;
// initialize the sdk client using a proxy configuration
$client = QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiClientBuilder::init()
    ->proxyConfiguration(
        ProxyConfigurationBuilder::init('http://localhost')
            ->port(8080)
            ->auth('username', 'password')
            ->authMethod(CURLAUTH_BASIC)
            ->tunnel(true)
    )
    ->build();

Nodes.Text: Represents the logging configurations for API calls. Create instance using `LoggingConfigurationBuilder::init()`
Methods

Data: Takes in your custom implementation of the Psr\Log\LoggerInterface.php. **Default Implementation : `ConsoleLogger`**
Defines the log message severity mentioned in Psr\Log\LogLevel.php (e.g., DEBUG, INFO, etc). **Default : `logLevel::INFO`**
Toggles the global setting to mask sensitive HTTP headers in both requests and responses before logging, safeguarding confidential data. **Default : `true`**
The logging configurations for an API request.
The logging configurations for an API response.

Nodes.Text: Usage Example
Client Initialization with Custom Logger

In order to provide custom logger, any implementation of the `Psr\Log\LoggerInterface` can be used so that you can override the `log` behavior and provide its instance directly in the SDK client initialization.
The following example uses `Monolog\Logger` implementation of `Psr\Log\LoggerInterface` for QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiClient initialization.

<?php

use QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiLib\QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiClientBuilder;
use QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiLib\Logging\LoggingConfigurationBuilder;
use QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiLib\Logging\RequestLoggingConfigurationBuilder;
use QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiLib\Logging\ResponseLoggingConfigurationBuilder;
use Psr\Log\LogLevel;
use Monolog\Logger;
use Monolog\Handler\StreamHandler;

// create a log channel
$logger = new Logger('QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi');
$logger->pushHandler(new StreamHandler(__DIR__ . '/api_data.log'));

// initialize the sdk client using this logger
$client = QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiClientBuilder::init()
    ->loggingConfiguration(
        LoggingConfigurationBuilder::init()
            ->logger($logger)
            ->level(LogLevel::INFO)
            ->requestConfiguration(RequestLoggingConfigurationBuilder::init()->body(true))
            ->responseConfiguration(ResponseLoggingConfigurationBuilder::init()->headers(true))
    )
    ->build();
Represents the logging configurations for API requests. Create instance using `RequestLoggingConfigurationBuilder::init()`
Methods

Data: Toggles the inclusion of query parameters in the logged request path. **Default : `false`**
Toggles the logging of the request body. **Default : `false`**
Toggles the logging of the request headers. **Default : `false`**
Includes only specified request headers in the log output. **Default : `[]`**
Excludes specified request headers from the log output. **Default : `[]`**
Logs specified request headers without masking, revealing their actual values. **Default : `[]`**

Nodes.Text: Represents the logging configurations for API responses. Create instance using `ResponseLoggingConfigurationBuilder::init()`
Methods

Data: Toggles the logging of the request body. **Default : `false`**
Toggles the logging of the request headers. **Default : `false`**
Includes only specified request headers in the log output. **Default : `[]`**
Excludes specified request headers from the log output. **Default : `[]`**
Logs specified request headers without masking, revealing their actual values. **Default : `[]`**

Nodes.Text: Represents a single Http Request.
Methods

Data: The HTTP method of the request.
The endpoint URL for the API request.

Nodes.Text: Represents the result of an API call, including the request details, response metadata, and the returned data.
Methods

Data: Returns the original request that resulted in this response.
Returns the original body from the response.
Checks if the response is successful (HTTP 2xx).
Checks if the response indicates an error. (not HTTP 2xx)
